{{For|the English soccer player of the same name|Dean Martin (footballer born 1957)}} {{Infobox person | name = Dean Paul Martin | image = | imagesize = | caption = | birth_name = Dean Paul Martin Jr. | birth_date = {{birth date|1951|11|17}} | birth_place = [[Santa Monica, California]], U.S. | death_date = {{death date and age|1987|03|21|1951|11|17}} | death_place = [[San Gorgonio Mountain]], [[California]], U.S. | death_cause = Military aircraft crash | othername = | homepage = | spouse = {{marriage|[[Olivia Hussey]]
|1971|1978|end=divorced}}
{{marriage|[[Dorothy Hamill]]
|1982|1984|end=divorced}} | children = 1 | parents = [[Dean Martin]]
Jeanne Biegger | relatives = [[Ricci Martin]] (brother)
[[Deana Martin]] (half-sister) }} '''Dean Paul Martin Jr.''' (November 17, 1951 – March 21, 1987) was the son of American entertainer [[Dean Martin]], and a singer and actor. ==Early life and career== Martin's parents were singer and entertainer [[Dean Martin]] and his second wife, Jeanne Biegger. Dean Paul was the fifth of Dean Martin's eight children, and was Jeanne's eldest son. He attended the [[Urban Military Academy]] in Brentwood, California. As a youth, Martin was encouraged toward a singing career. At age 13 he joined [[Desi Arnaz Jr.]] and [[Billy Hinsche]] in the pop group [[Dino, Desi, & Billy]], which had a few minor hits in the US between 1965 and 1968, landing in the Top 30 twice. Martin began to go by his given name of Dean Paul instead of the nickname "Dino" in his late teens. He became a successful tennis player (he competed in a junior competition at Wimbledon) and an actor. He co-starred with [[Ali MacGraw]] in the [[1979 in film|1979]] film ''[[Players (1979 film)|Players]]'', starring as a professional tennis player, for which he was nominated for a [[Golden Globe Award]] as Best New Star of the Year—Male. He later starred in the TV series ''[[Misfits of Science]]'' which aired during the 1985-1986 television season. The series co-starred [[Courteney Cox]]. His final film appearance came in ''[[Backfire (1988 film)|Backfire]]'', co-starring [[Karen Allen]] and [[Keith Carradine]], released in 1988 after Martin's death. ==Aviation career and death== Martin, an avid pilot, obtained his pilot's license at age 16 and became an officer in the [[California Air National Guard]] in 1981. He rose to the rank of captain. He died in 1987 when his [[Air National Guard]] [[F-4 Phantom II|F-4 Phantom]] [[jet fighter]] departed [[March Air Force Base]] and crashed in California's [[San Bernardino Mountains]] during a snowstorm, killing him and his weapons systems officer, Captain Ramon Ortiz.{{cite news|last=Arias|first=Ron|newspaper=People Magazine|url=http://people.com/archive/actor-athlete-and-dashing-pilot-dean-paul-martin-dies-when-his-jet-crashes-on-a-mountainside-vol-27-no-15/|title=Actor, Athlete and Dashing Pilot, Dean Paul Martin Dies When His Jet Crashes on a Mountainside|date=April 13, 1987|access-date=December 2, 2016}}{{cite news |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=8-xGAAAAIBAJ&sjid=VTMNAAAAIBAJ&pg=998%2C2199592 |newspaper=The Evening News |location=Newburgh, New York |agency=Associated Press |title=Dean Martin's son disappears in jet |date=March 24, 1987 |page=12A }}{{cite news |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=d38jAAAAIBAJ&sjid=cGUFAAAAIBAJ&pg=2449%2C4810240 |newspaper=Lewiston Daily Sun |location=Maine |agency=Associated Press |title=Dean Paul Martin's body taken off peak |date=March 27, 1987 |page=3}}{{cite news |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=mZMcAAAAIBAJ&sjid=NGMEAAAAIBAJ&pg=6831%2C5321847 |newspaper=Pittsburgh Press |agency=UPI |title=Dean Paul Martin's body found |date=March 26, 1987 |page=A9 }} He was 35 years old. Martin is buried in the [[Los Angeles National Cemetery]], a [[U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs]] cemetery in [[Los Angeles]], [[California]].{{cite news |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=ifwxAAAAIBAJ&sjid=g-QFAAAAIBAJ&pg=6336%2C1117918 |newspaper=Reading Eagle |location=Pennsylvania |agency=Associated Press |last=Wolfson |first=Lisa |title=Stars attend services for Dean Paul Martin |date=April 2, 1987 |page=38 }} ==Personal life== Martin married actress [[Olivia Hussey]] in 1971;{{cite news |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=1JBGAAAAIBAJ&sjid=Ti8NAAAAIBAJ&pg=3225%2C3377472 |newspaper=The Evening News |location=Newburgh, New York |agency=Associated Press |title=Dino Martin weds |date=April 19, 1971 |page=1}}{{cite news |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=xiU0AAAAIBAJ&sjid=zuAIAAAAIBAJ&pg=2012%2C981987|newspaper=The Bangor Daily News |location=Maine |agency=Associated Press |title=Dino Martin weds |date=April 19, 1971 |page=23}} they had one child, Alexander, and divorced in 1978.{{cite news |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=Nt0VAAAAIBAJ&sjid=8hEEAAAAIBAJ&pg=6681%2C231850 |newspaper=Milwaukee Sentinel |last=Wilson |first=Earl |agency= Field Enterprises, Inc. |title=Newly divorced Olivia visits |date=October 2, 1978|page=2, part 3 }} He married [[Figure skating at the 1976 Winter Olympics|Olympic gold medalist ice skater]] [[Dorothy Hamill]] in 1982,{{cite news |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=_oZUAAAAIBAJ&sjid=PY8DAAAAIBAJ&pg=2255%2C642126 |newspaper=Ellensburg Daily Record |location=Washington |agency=UPI |title=Dorothy Hamill marries Dean Martin's son |date=January 9, 1982 |page=12 }} and they divorced in 1984. ==References== {{Reflist|2}} {{Portal|Biography|United States Air Force}} ==External links== * {{IMDb name|552162|Dean Paul Martin}} * {{FAG|3535}} {{Dean Martin|state=collapsed}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Martin, Dean Paul}} [[Category:1951 births]] [[Category:1987 deaths]] [[Category:People from Santa Monica,
